New Records: Mexico secured a 4-2 win in the shootout and a place in the Copa America.
Luis Chávez scored a goal in the 43rd minute from a free-kick close to 30 yards away from net.
Key Match Events: Luis Chávez scored a goal in the 43rd minute from a free-kick close to 30 yards away from net.
Edson Álvarez scored a dramatic injury time goal in the 101st minute.
Mexico secured a 4-2 win in the shootout.
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico were looking to bounce back from a 2-0 away loss in the first quarterfinal leg.
Post-Match Reflections: Mexico secured a place in the 2024 Copa America after securing a 2-0 win over Honduras (2-2 on aggregate) that sent their Concacaf Nations League quarterfinal series to a penalty shootout and a 4-2 win for 'El Tri'.
Mexico will close out the year with a Dec. 16 friendly against Colombia at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in Mexico City's Estadio Azteca on Tuesday.
Others: Mexico's goalkeeper Angel Malagon made a pair of crucial saves.
Honduras' Anthony Lozano had a short-range header in the 61st minute.
